events.originalText: In a sting operation conducted by the FBI, Marion Barry (pictured), the mayor of Washington, D.C., was arrested for possession of crack cocaine.
events.subtitle: Sting operation
events.headline: Marion Barry, Mayor of Washington, D.C., Arrested for Possession of Crack Cocaine

events.originalText: Singaporean communist activist Tan Chay Wa was executed, leading to a much-publicised trial of his brother for engraving 'subversive' material on the gravestone.
events.subtitle: Malayan Communist Party
events.headline: Singaporean Communist Activist Tan Chay Wa Executed

events.originalText: Thirty years after his death, the International Olympic Committee presented commemorative medals to the family of American athlete Jim Thorpe, who had been stripped of his gold medals for playing semi-professional baseball before the 1912 Summer Olympics.
events.subtitle: International Olympic Committee
events.headline: IOC Presents Commemorative Medals to Jim Thorpe's Family

events.originalText: Thousands of Japanese police stormed the University of Tokyo after six months of nationwide leftist university student protests and occupation.
events.subtitle: University of Tokyo
events.headline: Japanese Police Storm University of Tokyo After Student Protests

events.originalText: Members of the Lumbee tribe arrived to protest at a Ku Klux Klan rally near Maxton, North Carolina, which turned into an armed confrontation between the two.
events.subtitle: Lumbee
events.headline: Lumbee Tribe Protests at Ku Klux Klan Rally in North Carolina

events.originalText: Willie O'Ree of the Boston Bruins played his first game in the National Hockey League, becoming the first black Canadian to compete in the NHL.
events.subtitle: Willie O'Ree
events.headline: Willie O'Ree Becomes First Black Canadian to Play in NHL

events.originalText: Navvab Safavi, an Iranian Shia cleric and the founder of the fundamentalist group Fada'iyan-e Islam, was executed with three of his followers for attempting to assassinate Prime Minister Hossein Ala'.
events.subtitle: Navvab Safavi
events.headline: Iranian Shia Cleric Navvab Safavi Executed for Assassination Attempt

events.originalText: Construction began on the United Nations Military Cemetery (pictured), the only United Nations cemetery in the world, in Busan, South Korea.
events.subtitle: United Nations Memorial Cemetery
events.headline: Construction Begins on United Nations Military Cemetery in Busan, South Korea

events.originalText: World War II: In Operation Iskra, the Red Army established a narrow land corridor to Leningrad, partially easing the protracted German siege.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Red Army Establishes Land Corridor to Leningrad in Operation Iskra

events.originalText: Japanese prime minister Ōkuma Shigenobu issued the Twenty-One Demands to China in a bid to increase Japan's power in East Asia.
events.subtitle: Ōkuma Shigenobu
events.headline: Japanese Prime Minister Issues Twenty-One Demands to China

events.originalText: A number of previously independent states united to form the German Empire, with Wilhelm I as emperor.
events.subtitle: Unification of Germany
events.headline: German Empire Formed with Wilhelm I as Emperor

events.originalText: The armed tender HMS Supply, the first ship of the First Fleet, arrived at Botany Bay, Australia.
events.subtitle: Ship's tender
events.headline: HMS Supply Arrives at Botany Bay, Australia

events.originalText: Francisco Pizarro founded Ciudad de los Reyes (present-day Lima, Peru) as the capital of the lands he conquered for the Spanish crown.
events.subtitle: Francisco Pizarro
events.headline: Francisco Pizarro Found Ciudad de los Reyes in Peru

events.originalText: The young child Leo II became the sole Byzantine emperor upon the death of his grandfather Leo I.
events.subtitle: Leo II (emperor)
events.headline: Leo II Becomes Sole Byzantine Emperor
